title: These 4 Winter Trends Look So Chic With Jeans
text: Trends may come and go, but denim is forever. Certain silhouettes and washes ebb and flow in popularity, but jeans are a constant in most of our wardrobes throughout the year. That's true for me, at least. Since denim is always in my rotation, I like to note which trends pair well with jeans at the top of each season. Though denim never goes out of style, pairing my favorite jeans with a current trend keeps them feeling fresh and modern.After saving new styling ideas from Instagram and my favorite retailers over the last few weeks, I noticed a few winter trends that look especially chic with jeans. There are four trends that fashion people everywhere seem to be wearing with jeans right now, each of which elevates the outfit instantly. Pairing your jeans with one of these adds a polished touch—even in the dreary days of winter. Below, I'm highlighting the four best winter trends to wear with jeans, from the coat style of the moment to the season's biggest texture.1. MAXI COATSExtra-long silhouettes elevate anything you pair them with, but the coat style of the season looks particularly polished with denim. There's something about the mix of textures that adds interest to both pieces—not to mention the practical element. Helsa Italian Wool Blend Topcoat NOUR HAMMOUR Evita Extra Long Coat MANGO Double-Breasted Wool Coat Reformation Cotswolds Coat ZARA Long Herringbone Coat 2. ESPRESSO BROWNThe color of the year happens to complement denim perfectly. Deep, dark brown pairs well with virtually all denim styles, from vintage-looking light-wash jeans to dark straight-leg jeans. Whether it's a coat, sweater, belt, or boots, the juxtaposition of rich espresso brown adds an elevated touch to jeans. j.crew Suede Roller-Buckle Belt Reformation Elio Knit Top Steve Madden Dollie Boots Polo Ralph Lauren Cable-Knit Wool-Cashmere Cardigan Freja Mercer Bag Espresso Camila Coelho Ambrosia Leather Moto Jacket 3. FAUX FURSpeaking of juxtaposing textures, faux fur and denim are an utterly chic combination. The two may seem contradictory, but faux fur provides a glamorous element to jeans that's perfect for the winter season. MANGO Manteco Wool Coat With Detachable Fur Collar NOUR HAMMOUR Evita Shearling Scarf Adrienne Landau The Cornelia Faux Fur Peacoat ZARA Faux Fur Knit Beanie THE FRANKIE SHOP Joni Oversized Belted Double-Breasted Faux Fur Coat L'Academie Savoie Faux Fur Jacket 4. LOAFERSLoafers never go out of style, but they're exceptionally popular right now and look so elegant with jeans. The denim hem next to leather or suede loafers feels both classic and modern at the same time. I love adding cashmere socks in an unexpected color for extra polish. SAINT LAURENT Leather Loafers Veronica Beard Penny Loafer Reformation Ani Ruched Loafer SHOP JEANS Favorite Daughter Valentina Super High Rise Boot Cut Jean FRAME The Ruler High-Rise Slim-Leg Jeans Hudson Jeans Barbara High Rise Bootcut LEVI'S Ribcage Full Length COTTON CITIZEN Cindy Jean
html:
Trends may come and go, but denim is forever. Certain silhouettes and washes ebb and flow in popularity, but jeans are a constant in most of our wardrobes throughout the year. That's true for me, at least. Since denim is always in my rotation, I like to note which trends pair well with jeans at the top of each season. Though denim never goes out of style, pairing my favorite jeans with a current trend keeps them feeling fresh and modern.

After saving new styling ideas from Instagram and my favorite retailers over the last few weeks, I noticed a few winter trends that look especially chic with jeans. There are four trends that fashion people everywhere seem to be wearing with jeans right now, each of which elevates the outfit instantly. Pairing your jeans with one of these adds a polished touch—even in the dreary days of winter. Below, I'm highlighting the four best winter trends to wear with jeans, from the coat style of the moment to the season's biggest texture.

1. MAXI COATS

Extra-long silhouettes elevate anything you pair them with, but the coat style of the season looks particularly polished with denim. There's something about the mix of textures that adds interest to both pieces—not to mention the practical element.

Helsa

Italian Wool Blend Topcoat

NOUR HAMMOUR

Evita Extra Long Coat

MANGO

Double-Breasted Wool Coat

Reformation

Cotswolds Coat

ZARA

Long Herringbone Coat

2. ESPRESSO BROWN

The color of the year happens to complement denim perfectly. Deep, dark brown pairs well with virtually all denim styles, from vintage-looking light-wash jeans to dark straight-leg jeans. Whether it's a coat, sweater, belt, or boots, the juxtaposition of rich espresso brown adds an elevated touch to jeans.

j.crew

Suede Roller-Buckle Belt

Reformation

Elio Knit Top

Steve Madden

Dollie Boots

Polo Ralph Lauren

Cable-Knit Wool-Cashmere Cardigan

Freja

Mercer Bag Espresso

Camila Coelho

Ambrosia Leather Moto Jacket

3. FAUX FUR

Speaking of juxtaposing textures, faux fur and denim are an utterly chic combination. The two may seem contradictory, but faux fur provides a glamorous element to jeans that's perfect for the winter season.

MANGO

Manteco Wool Coat With Detachable Fur Collar

NOUR HAMMOUR

Evita Shearling Scarf

Adrienne Landau

The Cornelia Faux Fur Peacoat

ZARA

Faux Fur Knit Beanie

THE FRANKIE SHOP

Joni Oversized Belted Double-Breasted Faux Fur Coat

L'Academie

Savoie Faux Fur Jacket

4. LOAFERS

Loafers never go out of style, but they're exceptionally popular right now and look so elegant with jeans. The denim hem next to leather or suede loafers feels both classic and modern at the same time. I love adding cashmere socks in an unexpected color for extra polish.

SAINT LAURENT

Leather Loafers

Veronica Beard

Penny Loafer

Reformation

Ani Ruched Loafer

SHOP JEANS

Favorite Daughter
